TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridTextBoxColumn extends System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle

Docs.summary: Hosts a control in a cell of a for editing strings.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> class derives from the `abstract` class <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle>. At run time, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> hosts a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox> control that allows users to edit text.
Special properties added to the class include <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.Format%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.HideEditBox%2A>. These properties allow you to access the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBox> control and its attributes, and set the format for displaying values.
If the data source is a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> containing <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> objects, the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.DataType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> should be set to a data type that can logically be edited in a text box control. The following data types are automatically associated with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> : <xref:System.Byte>, <xref:System.DateTime>, <xref:System.Decimal>, <xref:System.Double>, <xref:System.Int16>, <xref:System.Int32>, <xref:System.Int64>, <xref:System.UInt16>, <xref:System.UInt32>, <xref:System.UInt64>, <xref:System.Single>, and <xref:System.String>.
> [!NOTE] > The following types are not fully supported by Visual Basic: <xref:System.DateTime>, <xref:System.UInt16>, <xref:System.UInt32>, <xref:System.UInt64>, and <xref:System.TimeSpan>. (Operators are not allowed.)
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> and adds it to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.GridColumnStylesCollection> of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid>. To run this code example, paste it into a form that has a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> named `dataGrid1` and call it from the constructor of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>.
[!code-cpp[Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.DataGridTextBoxColumn1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.DataGridTextBoxColumn1 Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.DataGridTextBoxColumn1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.DataGridTextBoxColumn1 Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.DataGridTextBoxColumn1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.DataGridTextBoxColumn1 Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create a custom format for the displayed data.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle> uses a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor> to determine the type of data displayed in the column. To return a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase.GetItemProperties%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.BindingManagerBase> class.
For more information about formatting characters, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member.

Docs.summary: Initiates a request to complete an editing procedure.
Docs.returns: if the value was successfully committed; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The method checks to ensure that an edit is indeed occurring. If so, it formats the value appropriately. If the value is `null`, the method enters <xref:System.Convert.DBNull> into the column; otherwise, it uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle.SetColumnValueAtRow%2A> method to commit the value.
The method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> when an editing operation is committed.

Docs.summary: Prepares a cell for editing.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle.Edit%2A> sites a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control on the grid at the location of the cell being edited. The method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> class's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.BeginEdit%2A> method when an editing operation is about to begin.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.Edit%2A> method to change the text of a clicked cell in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control.
[!code-cpp[Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.Edit Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.Edit Example/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.Edit Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.Edit Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.Edit Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.Edit Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Ends an edit operation on the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks To edit the value of a cell, call the <xref:System.Data.DataRow> object's <xref:System.Data.DataRow.BeginEdit%2A> before changing the value. You must invoke the <xref:System.Data.DataRow.AcceptChanges%2A> method on both the <xref:System.Data.DataRow> and <xref:System.Data.DataTable> objects before the change is committed.
## Examples The following example invokes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.EndEdit%2A> method before editing a column's value.
[!code-vb[Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.EndEdit Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/Classic DataGridTextBoxColumn.EndEdit Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

## Examples The following example tests a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle> to determine its column type. If the column is a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn>, and the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> allows `null` values, then the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridColumnStyle.NullText%2A> property is set and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.EnterNullValue%2A> method invoked.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the character(s) that specify how text is formatted.
Docs.value: The character or characters that specify how text is formatted.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.Format%2A> property specifies how values are displayed in the column. For example, set the property to "c" to specify that the values will be formatted as the local currency. The <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> for the computer is used to determine the actual currency format. The values are automatically unformatted to the native type when data is changed.
For more information about formatting characters, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md).
The format you apply should be appropriate to the data type. For example, if the data is numeric in nature use one of the numeric format strings.
You can change the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.FormatInfo%2A> property to a new <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> instance constructed with an appropriate culture ID.
To set the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> for the application, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.CurrentCulture%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application> object to a new <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> instance constructed with an appropriate culture ID.
## Examples The following example creates a new <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> object and assigns it to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.FormatInfo%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> object. The example also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.Format%2A> property to "c" to specify that the column should display values as currency.
[!code-cpp[DataGridTextBoxColumn Format#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DataGridTextBoxColumn Format/CPP/datagridtextboxcolumn format.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[DataGridTextBoxColumn Format#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DataGridTextBoxColumn Format/CS/datagridtextboxcolumn format.cs#1)] [!code-vb[DataGridTextBoxColumn Format#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DataGridTextBoxColumn Format/VB/datagridtextboxcolumn format.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the culture specific information used to determine how values are formatted.
Docs.value: An object that implements the interface, such as the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.Format%2A> property to one of the formatting characters, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> uses the information provided by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.FormatInfo%2A> property to further specify what cultural-specific formatting to use. For example, when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.Format%2A> property is set to the format character "c" (for currency), you can further specify that the symbol for the lira be used. To do this, create a new <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> object with the locale ID for Italy, and set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.FormatInfo%2A> property to the new <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> object.
For more information about formatting characters, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md).
## Examples The following example creates a new <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> object and assigns it to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.FormatInfo%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn> object. The example also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridTextBoxColumn.Format%2A> property to "c" to specify that the column should display values as currency.
[!code-cpp[DataGridTextBoxColumn Format#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DataGridTextBoxColumn Format/CPP/datagridtextboxcolumn format.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[DataGridTextBoxColumn Format#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DataGridTextBoxColumn Format/CS/datagridtextboxcolumn format.cs#1)] [!code-vb[DataGridTextBoxColumn Format#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/DataGridTextBoxColumn Format/VB/datagridtextboxcolumn format.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks When this methods is called, the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control is added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection>. This allows the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager> to associate both controls with the same data source.
